references.paper_title: A learning algorithm for Boltzmann machines
references.reason: This paper introduces a fundamental learning algorithm for Boltzmann machines, a foundational model in neural networks which is relevant to the current work on language models.
This paper is highly influential in establishing the capabilities of large language models as few-shot learners, a key concept underlying the current research.

references.paper_title: Scaling laws for neural language models
references.reason: This work is seminal in establishing scaling laws for neural language models, a topic directly relevant to the study of compute-optimal inference.

references.paper_title: Training verifiers to solve math word problems
references.reason: This paper introduces a key dataset and methodology for evaluating mathematical reasoning capabilities in LLMs, forming a basis for the current study.

references.paper_title: Show your work: Scratchpads for intermediate computation with language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of using scratchpads to enhance intermediate computation in LLMs, a technique relevant to improving inference strategies.
